list.title: ConfigService
list.description:
NodeJS Config Service.

Simplified config management for node applications. ConfigService accepts a configuration object of properties to be defined using the node process env and run time overrides.

list.title: ConfigAggregateErrors
list.description: Creates an instance representing several errors wrapped in a single error when multiple errors need to be reported by an operation, for example by Promise.any().

list.title: ConfigError
list.description:
The Error() constructor creates an error object.

See Error for more details.

list.title: ConfigRangeError
list.description:
ConfigRangeError constructor.

Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when a numeric variable or parameter is outside its valid range.

See RangeError for more details.

list.title: ConfigReferenceError
list.description:
ConfigReferenceError constructor.

Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when de-referencing an invalid reference.

See ReferenceError for more details.

list.title: ConfigSyntaxError
list.description:
ConfigSyntaxError constructor.

Creates an instance representing a syntax error.

See SyntaxError for more details.

list.title: ConfigTypeError
list.description:
ConfigTypeError constructor.

Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when a variable or parameter is not of a valid type.

See TypeError for more details.

list.title: ConfigURIError
list.description:
ConfigURIError constructor.

Creates an instance representing an error that occurs when encodeURI() or decodeURI() are passed invalid parameters.

See URIError for more details.

list.title: loadEnv
list.description:
Load environment variables into process.env using dotenv.

NOTE: Should be placed as early as possible on startup.

list.title: ConfigErrors
list.description:
This namespace contains documentation for config service errors.

To allow you to do easier debugging ConfigService provides custom error classes. All of these errors are exposed on the ConfigService object and the configService constructor.

This means that errors can be accessed using ConfigService.ConfigError
